desc: If you have both general information and specific information, you tend to focus on the specific. The fallacy is committed when a person judges that an outcome will occur based on the specifics, ignoring the general probability that a thing is true.
exam: About 8% of all men are colorblind, but in your user research, testing an interface with a 3:1 color contrast ratio, 99/100 users report no problem. You would then assume that that less that only one percent of users have an issue - when, in fact, 8% will.
